title: Sara McGrath steps out in a glittery turban with Glenn McGrath at the Everest Carnival Fashion Lunch
text:
Sara McGrath opted for an eclectic ensemble when she stepped out for the Inaugural Everest Carnival Fashion Lunch in Sydney on Thursday.

The 37-year-old wife of former cricketer Glenn McGrath donned a slightly mismatched outfit, which included a glittery gold turban.

She paired it with a long, paisley print green sundress, which featured a keyhole opening at the bust and tie front.

Coupled: Sara McGrath opted for an eclectic ensemble when she stepped out for the Inaugural Everest Carnival Fashion Lunch in Sydney on Thursday. Pictured with husband Glenn McGrath

Sara also wore a bright pink patterned scarf, which she styled as a shawl around her shoulders.

She rounded out her ensemble with a pair of strappy gold high heels and a chunky gold statement bangle with a purple stone.

In keeping with the theme of her seemingly gypsy-inspired creation, Sara also donned a gold disc necklace, and opted for bright pink lipstick.

Head gear: The 37-year-old wife of former cricketer Glenn McGrath donned a slightly mismatched outfit, which included a glittery gold turban

Mixing it up: She paired her turban with a long, paisley print green sundress, which featured a keyhole opening at the bust and tie front

The Italian-born interior designer was accompanied by her husband of almost nine years, Glenn.

The 49-year-old former cricket bowler stepped out in a charcoal grey check suit.

He also wore a white shirt and bright pink tie, and rounded out the ensemble with a pair of black lace-up brogues.

Well-suited: The 49-year-old former cricket bowler stepped out in a charcoal grey check suit for the lunch

Tied up: He also wore a white shirt and bright pink tie, and rounded out the ensemble with a pair of black lace-up brogues

The couple happily posed for photos together on the pink carpet, wrapping an affectionate arm around each other's waists.

Described as 'Sydney’s most desirable spring fashion event', according to the Royal Randwick Facebook page, this year's lunch attracted a host of celebrities.

Also in attendance were Ricki-Lee Coulter, James Tobin, newlyweds James Stewart and Sarah Roberts, and jockey Michelle Payne.
